City Projects

City Spotlights

  1. Closure - S 12th St at the Railroad Crossing

    Read on...

  2. IFA awards more than $8.6 million in Federal Housing Tax Credits - Marshalltown project included

    “The Marshalltown Lofts will bring critically-needed affordable housing to our community, which is of especial importance as we continue our tornado recovery efforts,” said Marshalltown Mayor Joel Greer. Read on...

  3. NEW Lead Based Paint Hazard Reduction Program starts April 1st

    Do you live in a home built before 1978? Do you have children in the home who are under the age of 6? If so you may qualify for assistance through the HUD Lead Based Paint Hazard Reduction Program. Read on...

  4. Pre-Application Now Available for Catalyst Building Grant Funds

    The City of Marshalltown is now accepting pre-applications for the $1 million in Catalyst Building grant funds Read on...

  5. Applications Now Available for $1 million in Low-Interest Loans for Downtown

    The Iowa Finance Authority has dedicated $1 million in low interest loans for Marshalltown through the Main Street Iowa Mortgage program Read on...

  6. Fundraising Underway for the Renovation of the Veterans Memorial Coliseum

    Effort to raise $1.35 million needed to help complete the renovation of the Veterans Memorial Coliseum kicks off on 90th anniversary of dedication of the building Read on...

  7. Sign Up for notifications on our website

    Stay up-to-date on the latest news and events by signing up for our notification service. Read More
/CivicAlerts.aspx

City News

  1. MPD Death Investigation - Grommet Missing Person Investigation

    On Monday, April 15, 2019, at 9:07 a.m., the Marshalltown Police Department received a report of a discovered corpse in a farm field just east of Walmart (2800 block of South Center Street). Read on...

  2. Marshalltown Shooting Investigation - UPDATE - ARREST MADE

    Read on...

  3. Marshalltown Shooting Investigation

    Read on...
